data.title: Creatures of Sonaria Wiki
authors: Contributors to Creatures of Sonaria Wiki
data.text:
Legacy Mode

Main Gachas

These gachas are available year-round, and contain the majority of the game's creatures.

Diet Gachas

(See also: Diet Gacha Drops)

These gachas are the first gachas the player sees in the 'Buy Creatures' menu. These gachas sort creatures by what kinds of food they can eat; in other words, their diet. This category includes the following gachas:

Carnivores Gacha ( 65 Shooms)

Herbivores Gacha ( 65 Shooms)

Omnivores Gacha ( 85 Shooms)

Type Gachas

(See also: Type Gacha Drops)

Gachas that sort creatures by type (ex. flying, aquatic, semi-aquatic). Each gacha sorts creatures based on what environment the creature can live in. The only creature type that is not included in this gacha type are terrestrial (grounded) creatures. This category includes the following gachas:

Sky Gacha ( 150 Shooms)

Sea Gacha ( 150 Shooms)

Semi-Aquatic Gacha ( 200 Shooms)

Status Effect Gachas

(See also: Status Effect Gacha Drops)

Gachas that sort creatures based on what kind of status they inflict when biting/getting bit other creatures, such as poison or bleed. Each gacha in this category costs 350 Shooms. This category includes the following gachas:

Toxic Gacha ( 350 Shooms)

Bleeder Gacha ( 350 Shooms)

Session Gacha

The Session Gacha is a unique gacha that can only be spun once the player has completed a certain set of tasks. Once the player completes these tasks, the player will be given a Session Gacha Token, and can roll the gacha for 500 Shooms. Once the player rolls the gacha, the token will be consumed and the gacha will lock back up, unlocking when the player gains another token.

The tasks are as follows:

Drink 100 water.

Eat 100 food.

Kill 3 players.

Experience a weather event.

Grow from baby to adult.

The creatures in this gacha are as follows:

(6.25% chance)

Celeritas

Crata Peretina

Dieamarjla

Emphines

Ferrah

Galtekron

Gobli

Gurava

Hikorshi

Knalriki

Pernirex

Thykallos

Tsugae

Turgeon

Vetemortem

Zhelijin

Travelers Gacha

The Travelers Gacha is a gacha based on a similar system that the Session gacha has. As such, it can only be spun once the player has completed a certain set of tasks. Once the player completes these tasks, the player will be given a Travelers Gacha Token/unlock the gacha, and can roll the gacha for 250 Shooms. Once the player rolls the gacha, the token will be consumed and the gacha will lock back up, unlocking when the player gains another token/completes the quests. Once the gacha has been unlocked you can perform the same quests again within the same boost cycle, allowing for players to keep a pipeline which lets them do half the quests for the next token unlock once they have unlocked a new token.

The tasks are as follows (please note that in-game the travelling part is poorly indicated and seems to be inside the "2 boost creatures" part while in fact it is not):

Use 2 or more creature species with Daily Boosts and (please note that once the daily boosts change, the incomplete progress done with a creature for those quests resets; but if the part needed for an specific creature and quest was completed before the daily boosts updated, such respective progress for that creature won't be lost)

Kill 2 creatures with each of those 2 boosted creatures, having the Creature Stat Boost (4 kills in total). NOTE: According to the developers grabbing a player and killing them while holding and one shot killing another player do not count for kills. Only the latter doesn't work, since the former works as long as you are lighter than the victim.

Grow 2 creatures with growth boost.

Play for 30 minutes with a creature with Glimmer Boost (for each one; 60 minutes in total).

Travel 35k studs on Land

Travel 20k studs at Sea.

Travel 50k studs by air.

The creatures in this gacha are as follows:

(14.2% chance)

Avothius

Dalghara

Flickaflie

Geoptxina

Haxaline

Konomushi

Meorlark

Nakamaska

Explorer Gachas

The Explorer Gachas are unique in that they can only be unlocked by collecting their respective capsules (also known as tokens). Once a player collects a capsule, they can unlock the respective matching gacha and choose to roll it in exchange for that Explorer Gacha's designated Shoom cost. Only one capsule can exist on the map at a time (either Photovore, Galaxy, Mecha, or Monster), there cannot be one of each at the same time), they spawn anywhere on the map where food might also spawn, and each capsule has a unique percent chance of spawning after a player collects the currently available capsule on the map.

Tokens cannot typically be sniffed by creatures, but can easily be spotted due to the glow they produce. However, with a Springram Plushie equipped, tokens can be located via smell and have uniquely-colored scent lines for each type.

Gacha Name Capsule Cost per Roll Photovore Explorer Gacha Photovore Explorer Gacha capsule 100 Shooms per roll Galaxy Explorer Gacha Galaxy Explorer Gacha capsule 500 Shooms per roll Mecha Explorer Gacha Mecha Explorer Gacha capsule 300 Shooms per roll Monster Explorer Gacha Monster Explorer Gacha capsule 600 Shooms per roll Sweet Explorer Gacha Sweet Explorer Gacha capsule 700 Shooms per roll

Notes

Monster Explorer Gacha tokens only appear during Famine and Drought conditions.

Mutation Explorer Gacha tokens were converted to Mecha Explorer Gacha tokens and the Mutation Gacha was once again removed. Upon removal, the gacha enabled rolling with the cost of 300 Shooms and the designated explorer token.

Creatures which were formally included in the Mutation Explorer Gacha but did not appear in the new Mecha Explorer Gacha can now be found in the Monster Explorer Gacha.

Sweet Explorer Gacha tokens only appear during Cherry Blossom conditions, during which it has a 20% chance of spawning.

Tikit-based gachas

Tikit-baseed gachas are those which use Tikits to spin.

Tikit Gacha

The Tikit Gacha was the first tikit-based gacha. As thus, it keeps its name.

Each spin costs 10 Tikits, although it has been stated by Wolfragon that this is subject to change in the future.

The creatures in this gacha follow the design theme of royalty; as of Recode, that theme has continued with further additions to the gacha.

The creatures in this gacha are as follows:

(25% chance)

Empiterium

Erridea

Eskarlor

Leurimess

Time Gacha

The Time Gacha is a feature that can be unlocked by actively playing the game for a certain amount of hours. The more hours you play, the more Time Currency a player can accumulate to buy higher tier Time Gachas. Time Currency is not gained when in the Main Menu. Time Currency will subtract itself from the total amount of time played each time a player rolls a Time Gacha. It may be accessed by clicking on the "TIME GACHA" button.

It should be noted that the "all time" counter resets periodically, so it may not display the amount of time played accurately.

The Time Gacha is technically several smaller gachas, but each gacha contains only 1 creature, guaranteeing the player's desired drop. The Time Gacha contains the following creatures:

Time Creature Tiers Creature Name 30 Minutes Tier 1 Yiepir 2 Hours Tier 3 Aesho 5 Hours Tier 3 Geogoff 10 Hours Tier 4 Verklixin 30 Hours Tier 3 Zwevealisk 50 Hours Tier 4 Haechionx 100 Hours Tier 5 Yeba'idi 200 Hours Tier 4 Seradae 300 Hours Tier 5 Hellion Warden

Robux Shop

(See also: Robux Shop Creatures)

Instead of using an in-game currency to spin, the Robux Shop (previously known as the Robux Gacha) requires Robux to buy directly, fortunately without the need to spin. Creatures in this shop follow common design themes, much like the creatures within the Limited Gachas.

Time Sensitive Gachas

These gachas contain creatures which may not be available during all parts of the year, and may cycle through creatures as time goes on.

Limited Gacha

(See also: Limited Gacha Drops)

The Limited Gacha contains usually 2 creatures at a time whose designs follow a certain theme. These 2 creatures stay in the Limited Gacha for a period of time before they are cycled out for another set of 2 creatures. In order to be able to roll this gacha, the player must have 55 unique species of creatures unlocked. The current price for one roll is 2,500 Shooms. The previous and current gacha themes are as follows:

Dinosaur (current, returning)

Elemental (previous)

Ancient History (previous)

Event Gachas

(See also: Event Gacha Drops)

Event Gachas are gachas that become available according to real life holidays. Creatures that feature in an event gacha return as the gacha (or event) itself returns, alongside some new additions. The event gachas are as follows:

Christmas Gacha

Valentines Gacha

Easter Gacha

Recode Mode

Main Gachas

These gachas are available year-round, and contain the majority of the game's creatures.

All creatures on the diet, type and status effect gachas can also be found on the Mystery Gacha.

Diet Gachas

(See also: Diet Gacha Drops)

These gachas are the first gachas the player sees in the menu. These gachas sort creatures by what basic kinds of food they can eat; in other words, their diet - with the exclusion of photovores and photocarnivores. This category includes the following gachas:

Carnivores Gacha ( 65 Shooms)

Herbivores Gacha ( 65 Shooms)

Omnivores Gacha ( 85 Shooms)

Type Gachas

(See also: Type Gacha Drops)

Gachas that sort creatures by mobility type (ex. flying, aquatic, semi-aquatic). Each gacha sorts creatures based on what environment the creature can live in, according to the new mobility types and with all-terrain and glider semi-aquatics absorbed into fliers and semi-aquatics, respectively. The only creature types not included in this gacha type are terrestrial (grounded) and terrestrial glider creatures. This category includes the following gachas:

Sky Gacha ( 150 Shooms)

Aquatic Gacha / Sea Gacha ( 150 Shooms)

Semi-Aquatic Gacha ( 200 Shooms)

Status Effect Gachas

(See also: Status Effect Gacha Drops)

Gachas that sort creatures based on the kind of status they inflict when biting or being bitten by other creatures, such as poison or bleeding.. Each gacha in this category costs 350 Shooms. This category includes the following gachas:

Toxic Gacha ( 350 Shooms)

Bleeder Gacha ( 350 Shooms)

Token Gachas

Those which require of a token to roll.

Session Gacha

The Session Gacha is a unique gacha that can only be spun spending a certain Session Gacha Token, gained by completing a set of tasks or by trading specifically for it, plus an additonal monetary cost of 500 Shooms to roll. Once the player rolls the gacha, the token will be consumed, locking the gacha if no more Session Gacha Tokens are available. The tasks are as follows:

Eat 1000 units of food.

Drink 100 units of water.

Grow a creature to age 100.

Kill 3 adult creatures.

The creatures in this gacha are as follows:

(6.25% chance)

Celeritas

Crata Peretina

Dieamarjla

Emphines

Ferrah

Galtekron

Gobli

Gurava

Hikorshi

Knalriki

Pernirex

Thykallos

Tsugae

Turgeon

Vetemortem

Zhelijin

Boosted Gacha

The Boosted Gacha is the Recode's inheritor of the Traveler's Gacha a gacha based on a similar system that the Session gacha has. As such, it can only be spun once the player has a Boosted Token, given upon completing a certain set of tasks or trading, and can roll the gacha for 250 Shooms. Once the player rolls the gacha, the token will be consumed and the gacha will lock back up if the player has no more available tokens. Unlike Traveler's Gacha at its worst time, there is no cooldown between times counted for unlocking the gacha.

Gacha Price: 250 Shooms

The tasks are as follows:

Grow 10 different boosted creature to adulthood

Complete all missions & claim rewards from 50 region missions as a boosted creature

Travel 35,000 studs on land

Travel 35,000 studs by swimming

Travel 35,000 studs by flying

The creatures in this gacha are as follows:

(14.2% chance)

Avothius

Dalghara

Flickaflie

Geoptxina

Haxaline

Konomushi

Nakamaska

Master Gacha

The Master Gacha is a gacha introduced in Recode. As a token gacha, it can only be spun once the player has a Master token, which given upon completing a certain set of tasks or trading. Once the player rolls the gacha, the token will be consumed, and the gacha will lock back up if the player has no more available tokens.

Gacha Price: 500 Shooms

The tasks are as follows:

Spin Session/Boosted Gacha 5 times

Claim 5,000 Death Points in total

Complete 2 Weekly Missions

Nest 25 different people

The creatures in this gacha are as follows:

(50% chance)

Heiboktoruk

Lactarim

Explorer Gachas

The Explorer Gachas are unique in that they can only be unlocked by collecting their respective capsules (also known as tokens). Once a player collects a capsule, they can unlock the respective matching gacha and choose to roll it in exchange for that Explorer Gacha's designated Shoom cost. Only one capsule can exist on the map at a time (either Photovore, Galaxy, Mecha, or Monster), there cannot be one of each at the same time), they spawn anywhere on the map where food might also spawn, and each capsule has a unique percent chance of spawning after a player collects the currently available capsule on the map.

Tokens cannot typically be sniffed by creatures, but can easily be spotted due to the glow they produce, and they can be appraised if close enough to the object, indicating what token it is and allowing the creature to collect it by actively interacting (pressing E button).

These creatures are classified as "Exploration Special" in-game

Gacha Name Capsule Cost per Roll Photovore Explorer Gacha Photovore Explorer Gacha capsule 100 Shooms per roll Galaxy Explorer Gacha Galaxy Explorer Gacha capsule 500 Shooms per roll Mecha Explorer Gacha Mecha Explorer Gacha capsule 300 Shooms per roll Monster Explorer Gacha Monster Explorer Gacha capsule 300 Shooms per roll Sweet Explorer Gacha Sweet Explorer Gacha capsule 700 Shooms per roll

Notes

Monster Explorer Gacha tokens only appear during Famine and Drought conditions.

Sweet Explorer Gacha tokens only appear during Cherry Blossom conditions, during which it has a 20% chance of spawning.

Death Gacha

Gacha Price: 500 Shooms

The Death Gacha is a token-based gacha, similar to Session, Boosted and Explorer gachas, requiring a token (Death Gacha Token) to roll, but instead of being found in the game world or through an explicit mission, the token must be earned by earning a high enough death score. Its contents rotate every week, and may sometimes be paired, or go alone, meaning sometimes there could be a 100% drop chance for an specific creature, and others a 50% for one creature and 50% for another.

All creatures stemming from this gacha are tagged as "Death Gacha" in-game

The creatures in this gacha can be seen here.

Tikit-based gachas

Tikit-based gachas are those which cost Tikits to spin.

Royalty Gacha

The Royalty Gacha was the second tikit-based gacha introduced in Recode, but it essentially replaced the Tikit Gacha after the 3rd November 2023 so it can be considered the first. As its name suggests, the creatures in this gacha follow the theme of royalty.

Each spin costs 10 Tikits, although it has been stated by Wolfragon that this is subject to change in the future.

The creatures in this gacha can be seen here.

Celestial Gacha

The Celestial Gacha is the second tikit-based gacha with exclusive creatures to it, and the third Tikit gacha in total. As its name suggests, the creatures in this gacha follow a celestial theme.

Each spin costs 20 Tikits, although it has been stated by Wolfragon that this is subject to change in the future.

The creatures in this gacha can be seen here.

Mystery Gacha

The Mystery Gacha is a more expensive inheritor or Legacy's removed Random Gacha, with each spin costs 1 Tikits. As such, it has the largest pool of creatures, as it contains about every creature from the diet, mobility type and status effect gachas, without including limited, time-related, Robux, Session Gacha, Traveler Gacha, other Tikit-based gachas, Creature Mission or Secret Mission Creatures.

Time Points

The Time Points is the inheritor of Time Gacha and kept here for previously mentioned reasons.

Time Points can be unlocked by actively playing the game for a certain amount of hours. The more hours you play, the more Time Currency a player can accumulate to buy higher tier Time Gachas. Time Currency is not gained when in the Main Menu. Time Currency will subtract itself from the total amount of time played each time a player buys a Time Gacha Creature.

The Time Points Creature Shop contains the following creatures:

Time Creature Tiers Creature Name 35 Minutes (35 ) Tier 1 Yiepir 2 Hours (120 ) Tier 3 Aesho 5 Hours (300 ) Tier 3 Geogoff 10 Hours (600 ) Tier 4 Verklixin 30 Hours (1800 ) Tier 3 Zwevealisk 50 Hours (3000 ) Tier 4 Haechionx 100 Hours (6000 ) Tier 5 Yeba'idi 160 Hours (9600 ) Tier 3 Bolatra 200 Hours (12000 ) Tier 4 Seradae 300 Hours (18000 ) Tier 5 Hellion Warden

Robux Shop

(See also: Robux Shop Creatures)

Instead of using an in-game currency to spin, the Premium Creatures Shop, or Robux Shop (previously known as the Robux Gacha) requires Robux to buy directly, and without spin. Creatures in this shop follow common design themes, much like the creatures within the Limited Gachas.

Time Sensitive Gachas

These gachas contain creatures which may not be available during all parts of the year, and may cycle through creatures as time goes on.

Limited Gacha

(See also: Limited Gacha Drops)

The Limited Gacha contains usually 2 creatures at a time whose designs follow a certain theme. These 2 creatures stay in the Limited Gacha for a period of time before they are cycled out for another set of 2 creatures. In order to be able to roll this gacha, the player must have 55 unique species of creatures unlocked. The current price for one roll is 2,500 Shooms. The previous and current gacha themes can be seen here

Event Gachas

(See also: Event Gacha Drops)

Event Gachas are gachas that become available according to real life holidays. Creatures that feature in an event gacha return as the gacha (or event) itself returns, alongside some new additions. The event gachas are as follows:

There had never been Event gachas at this moment in Recode.
